definition: forced marriage/arranged marriage (without the consent of the individuals)
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

sentences.english: But it was also a bold attack on feudalism and arranged marriage.
sentences.chinese: 但它同时也是对封建制度和包办婚姻的一记猛击。

sentences.english: This is an example of the apparent success of arranged marriage.
sentences.chinese: 这是一例表面看来很成功的包办婚姻。

sentences.english: Arranged marriages happen overnight with the couple not knowing each other.
sentences.chinese: 印度包办婚姻现象严重，夫妻间甚至还未认识就结婚。

sentences.english: Even modern arranged marriages can have a large age difference within the couple。
sentences.chinese: 现代的包办婚姻中也有很多年龄差距很大的夫妇。

sentences.english: This is where the crucial difference with arranged marriages in China lies.
sentences.chinese: 这就使其与中国的包办婚姻的根本区别。

sentences.english: Now, 108 years later, the arranged marriage still rankles.
sentences.chinese: 年了，那段包办婚姻仍然让哈瓦感到不满。

sentences.english: child brides sometimes set themselves on fire to escape arranged marriages.
sentences.chinese: 那些童养媳有时会通过自焚来逃避包办婚姻。

definition: to regard men as superior to women (idiom)
to value males and attach less importance to females (idiom)
the families are well-matched in terms of social status (idiom)/(of a prospective marriage partner) an appropriate match
If you marry a chicken, follow the chicken (idiom); A woman should follow whatever her husband orders./We must learn to accept the people around us.
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law

Confucian moral injunctions for women, namely: obey in turn three men father, husband and son, plus the four virtues of morality 德, physical charm 容, propriety in speech 言 and efficiency in needlework 功
if you marry a chicken follow the chicken, if you marry a dog follow the dog (idiom)
pinyin: jia4 ji1 sui2 ji1 , jia4 gou3 sui2 gou3
